segments.text: [LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] Utterly, utterly ridiculous.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We were very much younger then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Very much sillier.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Mmhmm.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: However, I do believe the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh you knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents? It was a trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It was bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not at all. It was very pretty. I still wear it often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You sent out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I did not you worked whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, you let him kiss you.  You said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, what of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It gave him a lot, a great deal of pleasure and it didn't hurt me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And what about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: If you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey you'd never known a thing about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a nice point of view I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm bored with this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So am I.  I'm bored stiff.  You want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, thank you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll have a little, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see why you want any you already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, you know no particular reason besides they are very small glasses.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just think it's silly you know to go on and on and on about such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three glasses of liquor in a whole evening going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just, I just think it's becoming a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Hmm.  Well, you needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want any at the moment, okay?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do be quiet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be stupid, what?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Are you going out somewhere dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, darling I'm just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well it's a woman's duty to allure the man. Watch me a minute will you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As matter the fact that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh no, it isn't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be stupid, shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know, it's a pity you didn't have any more brandy. It would have made you just a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, well that's funny.  It doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know what?  You snap, you snap, you snap you're like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nonsense.  They have a bag of venom behind of fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't care.  I don't care, do you understand?  I don't mind if they bark and they roll about like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I suppose you let him just kiss you or good deal more than too.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, mind you own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I suppose you two had a riotous time, huh?  No restrain at all, very enjoyable, he never had much any how.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're quite insufferable, I expect it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I am not in the least bit drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think I told you once before that I had three minute liquor glasses the whole evening long.  A Child of two cannot get drunk on that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary, a child two could get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh very, very interesting Amanda.  How about the child of uh... four, six or maybe nine---you know, we could work up a splendid little debate about it, you know?  Intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Not very funny darling.  Why don't you have some more brandy?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a very good idea I think I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Would you uh...turn that off please? You're going to wake the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: There are no people upstairs. It's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well then you'll wake the people downstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They are away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is no time a year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I will do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Very well if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off. It's driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I won't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Stop it. No. Go away.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Amanda listen. Listen.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: listen Oh I'm sick and tired of listening to you, you damn sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's very amusing indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh you're cruel you're...you're...I hate you, I hate you. Go away. You're conceited. You're overbearing. You're utterly impossible.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You...You're an evil minded, self-centered little wench and I never want to see you again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end do you hear me?  Finally and forever.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not going like this.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh yes I am...Oh yes I am. Let go of me. You let go. You...urgh...You're a cruel friend. I loathe and I hate you. Marry you again...Ha...Never, never, never, never. I hope you die in torment. You beast.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No you're not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Shut up. Shut up. I wouldn't marry you again if you came crawling back to me on a bended knee. You are an evil tempered little vampire and I never want to see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M
